New Records: Heinrich Klaasen hit his first World Cup hundred, and it was the second-quickest hundred in this tournament, after Aiden Markram's 100 off a record 49 balls against Sri Lanka.
South Africa notched up the second-highest total in the tournament with 7-399.
England conceded its highest total in ODIs.
England faced its heaviest defeat by runs in ODIs.
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen made an unbeaten 75 off 42 balls.
England was dismissed for 170 in only 22 overs.
Klaasen and Jansen put on 151 runs together.
Rassie van der Dussen scored 60 off 61 balls.
Adil Rashid took key wickets to pull things back for England.
Reece Topley dismissed Markram and David Miller.
Klaasen and Jansen helped South Africa plunder 143 runs in the last 10 overs.
Jonny Bairstow was dismissed for 10 by Lungi Ngidi.
Marco Jansen dismissed Dawid Malan and Joe Root.
Ben Stokes was dismissed for 5 by Kagiso Rabada.
Gerald Coetzee dismissed Jos Buttler and Harry Brook.
Mark Wood scored 43 not out off 17 balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Heinrich Klaasen mentioned the team's familiarity with Indian conditions and their practice session before the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler acknowledged the tough position England is in and the difficulty of qualifying for the semifinals.
Heinrich Klaasen expressed pride in playing for his country and overcoming the loss to the Netherlands.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played in stifling conditions in Mumbai.
South Africa's big win cemented their third spot with six points.
England sank to ninth on the table, tied on two points with last-place Afghanistan.
